result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:09 AM CO: RMW, REP: Melstrom, CLERK: K Kittel. Defendant David Joshua Goodman not in court.  Attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Travis Satorius in court for David Joshua Goodman. Set for PLEAS. Court notes Atty Satorius' letter filed this morning, DE is not on zoom or in person. Court also notes return mail. Atty Satorius makes statements, his DE would like to go to trial. DE appeared in court at 9:12 am, makes statements. Court responds, sets JT and FPT,  All pretrial submissions are due no later 12/30, written scheduling order and instructions to follow. DE updates address and confirms phone number. Bond continues. Adjourned:  9:18 am.

ADA Becker will file an information to mirror complaint. Atty Satorius with that understanding will waive further reading and enter a NG plea. Court schedules for a pre trial conference. Address confirmed. Court adjourned at 11:41 a.m.

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Michael Joseph Becker   DF ATTY:  Travis Satorius   DF:  David Joshua Goodman appeared via phone. Case called at 11:37 a.m. Court notes this matter is set for a preliminary hearing. Atty Satorius has reviewed right with client and he is willing to waive preliminary hearing. Court reviews rights to a preliminary hearing. DE understands and waives preliminary hearing. Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Appointing Atty Travis Satorius. mw

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  John H.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

03:30 PM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: K. Anderson, ADA:  Brian Thomas Smestad appeared by video means, DF:  David Joshua Goodman appeared from jail, pro se. Court reviews DE's bond modification request. ADA Smestad objects to bond modification. DE makes argument. Court modifies bond from cash to signature. Adjourned: 3:39 PM. kma
Bail/bond hearing on February 15, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
